text: The Maine Black Bears women's basketball team is the basketball team that represents University of Maine in Orono, Maine, United States. The school's team currently competes in the America East Conference. ==History== From 1985 to 2004, the Black Bears went to 15 North Atlantic Conference/America East Conference tournament championships, winning seven of them and finishing as runner-up in the other eight. During the 2017–18 and 2018-19 season Maine has won back to back America East regular season and conference tournament championships. ==Year by year results== ==NCAA Tournament results== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- |- | rowspan=1 | 1995 || #16 || First Round || #1 Connecticut || L 75−105 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 1996 || #11 || First Round || #6 George Washington || L 67−83 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 1997 || #13 || First Round || #4 LSU || L 79−88 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 1998 || #13 || First Round || #4 NC State || L 64−89 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 1999 || #10 || First Round Second Round || #7 Stanford #2 Old Dominion || W 60−58 L 62−72 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 2000 || #12 || First Round || #5 North Carolina || L 57−62 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 2004 || #13 || First Round || #4 Texas Tech || L 50−60 |- style="text- align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 2018 || #15 || First Round || #2 Texas || L 54−83 |- style="text-align:center;" | rowspan=1 | 2019 || #14 || First Round || #3 NC State || L 51−63 |- style="text-align:center;" |} ==References== ==External links== *
